intro: Fagara volubilis, commonly known as the climbing evergreen shrub, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its woody stems that twine around supports as it climbs. Its leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a glossy dark green surface. Fagara volubilis produces small, white flowers that are followed by blue-black berries, which are an important food source for various wildlife.
